intro: Thecacoris gymnogyne var. glabroglandulosa, commonly known as the hairy glandular milkweed, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and glandular structures, which contribute to its unique appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive corolla. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands.
